Provider.title: Provider
Provider.description: Represents a provider in the system, storing their core registration and profile information.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Provider entity.

documentType.description: Type of document used for identification (e.g., NIT, CC).

businessName.description: The legal business name or individual name of the provider.

city.description: The city where the provider is located.

department.description: The department or state where the provider is located.

country.description: The country where the provider is located.

address.description: The physical address of the provider.

email.description: The email address of the provider, used for login and communication.

rutFileUrl.description: URL of the RUT file stored in cloud storage.

camaraComercioFileUrl.description: URL of the Camara de Comercio (Chamber of Commerce) file stored in cloud storage.

cedulaRepresentanteLegalFileUrl.description: URL of the Cedula (ID) of the legal representative file stored in cloud storage.

certificacionBancariaFileUrl.description: URL of the Certificacion Bancaria (Bank Certification) file stored in cloud storage.

sarlaftAccepted.description: Indicates whether the provider has accepted the SARLAFT terms and conditions.

formLocked.description: If true, the provider's form is locked and cannot be edited.

taxRegimeType.description: Type of tax regime (e.g., Simplificado, Común).

isLargeTaxpayer.description: Whether the provider is a large taxpayer (Sí/No).

largeTaxpayerResolution.description: Resolution number if a large taxpayer.

isIncomeSelfRetainer.description: Whether the provider is an income self-retainer (Sí/No).

incomeSelfRetainerResolution.description: Resolution number if an income self-retainer.

isIcaSelfRetainer.description: Whether the provider is an ICA self-retainer (Sí/No).

icaSelfRetainerResolution.description: Resolution number if an ICA self-retainer.

implementsEnvironmentalMeasures.description: Whether the provider implements environmental measures (Sí/No).

environmentalMeasuresDescription.description: Description of the environmental measures implemented by the provider.

legalRepresentativeDocumentType.description: Document type of the legal representative (e.g., CC, CE, Pasaporte).

legalRepresentativeDocumentNumber.description: Document number of the legal representative.

accountType.description: Type of bank account (e.g., Ahorros, Corriente).

beneficiaryName.description: Name of the bank account holder.

hseqSgsst.description: Indicates if the company has an SG-SST in accordance with Decree 1072, with an evaluation result of resolution 0312/19, above 60% (Sí/No).

id.description: Unique identifier for the AdminUser entity.

email.description: Email address of the admin user.  Used for login.

definition.description: Stores information for each provider. Provider can only access their own document.  The {providerId} MUST match the authenticated user's UID. No denormalization required as access control is based on path and UID.

params.name: providerId
params.description: The UID of the provider, matching the authenticated user's ID.

definition.description: Stores the IDs of admin users. Existence of a document at this path grants admin privileges. No data other than the document ID is required.

params.name: adminId
params.description: The UID of an administrator user.

firestore.reasoning:
This design prioritizes security and scalability for the Gestión de Proveedores application, focusing on Authorization Independence and clear data segregation.  The core entities are `Provider` and `AdminUser`. Providers will self-register and manage their information, while admins will have read-only access to provider data.

**Authorization Independence:**  The `providers/{providerId}` collection relies on the `request.auth.uid` being equal to the `{providerId}` to ensure providers can only access their own data. No `get()` calls are needed in security rules, enabling atomic operations.

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):**
*   Secure `list` operations are supported because the structure segregates provider data into individual documents (`providers/{providerId}`).  Listing providers requires admin privileges enforced by the `roles_admin/{uid}` collection. Normal users cannot list providers, preventing data leakage.
*   The `roles_admin/{uid}` collection uses "existence over content", simply checking if a document exists to grant admin privileges. This is a secure and scalable approach.

**Invariants:**
*   Ownership:  The `providers/{providerId}` path ensures that each provider can only manage their own data, determined by their `uid`.
*   Data Integrity:  The schema defines the required fields for a provider, ensuring consistent data across all provider profiles.

**Denormalization:** No explicit denormalization is required in this structure, as Authorization Independence is achieved through the path-based ownership of provider documents. If, in the future, admin users needed to update provider data, a `lastUpdatedBy` field could be added to the `Provider` schema to track who made the update, though this is not a current requirement.
